definitions: in a way that is plain and characterized by a lack of decorative or other features

examples.text: the suburbs that stretch blankly along the routes out from the city

shortDefinitions: in way that is characterized by lack of decoration

definitions: in a way that shows a lack of interest or engagement

examples.text: my home life consists of staring blankly at the television

shortDefinitions: in way that shows lack of interest or engagement

definitions: in a way that temporarily shows no emotion or understanding, especially as a result of shock

examples.text: he stared blankly at the freshly dug grave and new tombstone
the policeman's jaw had dropped in bewilderment and he was eyeing him blankly

shortDefinitions: in way that temporarily shows no emotion or understanding

definitions: in an absolute or blunt manner

examples.text: the hospital has blankly refused to carry out tests
officials have stated blankly that they will never extradite the operatives
